title: Big Benefits Handout family disgusted after NHS says their 5-year-old daughter is 'overweight'
text:
Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A father whose family starred in a reality TV programme about benefits says he was left furious after the NHS sent a letter telling him his young daughter was overweight. 
The letter from NHS community services encouraged Scott Gavin, 32, and his family to make "simple" lifestyle changes by becoming more active and eating healthy food. 
It arrived after his five-year-old daughter Ellie Mai was measured. 
Scott disputed the assessment and told the Liverpool Echo that he hasn't shared the information with his daughter to avoid upsetting her. The letter arrived after five-year-old Ellie Mai was measured Dad Scott Gavin was stunned when he read the letter 
The Gavin family, of Kirkby, Merseyside, shot to fame when they starred in the Channel 5 reality show Big Benefits Handout last year. Read More 
The family were given their £26,000 annual benefits allowance in one lump sum - and used it to create a mini zoo. 
Scott took to Facebook to air his disappointment at the letter, claiming Ellie Mai was not overweight. 
He said: “I’m fuming over it. She’s beautiful. Why send this out? As you can see, she’s clearly not overweight." 
One Facebook user commented: “She’s not overweight at all, that’s so harsh.” Scott hasn't shared the letter's contents with Ellie Mai 
Another added: “I’ve had these letters with [my children]. They don’t take certain things into account, no way is she overweight!” 
The letter is based on Ellie Mai’s BMI. The information contained in the letter has not been shared with Ellie Mai. 
Scott said: “It’s disgusting either way. Even if your child is overweight, letters like these are wrong. 
“It could mentally damage a child, seeing something like this. They’ll have plenty of things to make them feel insecure when they’re older. Let kids be kids.” 
The NHS says measurements are carried out by trained healthcare professionals. 
They are not compulsory but parents have to opt out if they don’t want their children to be measured. Like us on Facebook
